alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 11:32PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Red Willow, Hitchcock and Dundy Counties through 1130 PM MDT/1230 AM CDT/... At 1031 PM MDT/1131 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles east of Hayes Center to 17 miles north of Haigler. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of western Red Willow, Hitchcock and Dundy Counties, including the following locations... Parks and Max. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
